result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan R. Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with any other sentences

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharge. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Continue to comply with treatment recommendation from his recent AODA assessment.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use. 
Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done so.
Comply in any other counseling appropriate or deemed necessary as recommended by the Agent.
3 days jail credit, if revoked.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Balance due of court obligations are also converted to civil judgment.

Time Served
Concurrent with: with any sentence Defendant may be serving

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan R. Olson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Count 1 - nonprobation

Defendant Jonathan R. Olson in court with attorney Troy Louis Nielsen. Defendant Jonathan R. Olson in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:59 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Atty Nielsen received a copy of the revocation packet, has nothing to correct from a factual standpoint.

Atty Constable is prepared to proceed.

Court reviews the file. Defendant was placed on probation, sentence withheld on March 18, 2016.  Defendant broke a number of rules on supervision and the department has revoked the probation and returned Defendant for sentencing.

Atty Constable addresses the Court, joins in the recommendation of the department.

Atty Nielsen addresses the Court. 

Court addresses the parties. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 30 days
84 days jail credit
Time served
Concurrent to any sentence Defendant may be serving
Amount due $465.15, civil judgment is to be entered in this amount

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Count 1 - probation

9:25 a.m. Defendant Jonathan R. Olson in court with Attorney Halverson for Atty Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Probation w/conditions
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1 without repeater.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 
Repeater modifier is dismissed.

ADA Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson concurs with joint recommendation. 

BY THE COURT:***PROBATION***
12 months probation, concurrent with any other sentences
Conditions:
Continue to comply with treatment recommendation from his recent AODA assessment.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use. 
Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done so.
Comply in any other counseling appropriate or deemed necessary as recommended by the Agent.
Pay costs and DNA Surcharge.
3 days jail credit, if revoked.

01-20-16 Bond reinstated.
Maintain absolute sobriety both drug and alcohol free. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and take only as prescribed. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances illegally.

ADDRESS INFO for Jonathan R. Olson
Current: E1861 Amy St, Waupaca, WI 54981 United States  (Effective: 01-20-2016)
Prior: 1019 Arlington Place, Stevens Point, WI 54481

Defendant Jonathan R. Olson appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court questions the Defendant to his reasons for missing court. BTC: Court quashes warrant.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-18-2016 09:00 am

Body Only.
cc: DA w/ minutes 10/14/15 ks

Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:38 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearnces.

Defendant does not appear.

Matter is set for a plea and sentencing today.

Atty Drengler addresses the Court, anticipated his client's appearance today, is not sure why he is not here.

Defendant is out on bond.

State requests a bench warrant.
State prepared a writ for Waupaca County Jail but then was returned, Defendant was not incarcerated at that facility.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a bench warrant.

Maintain absolute sobriety both drug and alcohol free. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and take only as prescribed. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances illegally.

Defendant Jonathan R. Olson appeared by video. Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Knaapen makes statements re: status of case. Requests the warrant be quashed. 
BY THE COURT:  Warrant is quashed. 

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

Atty Drengler asks the bond to be reinstated. 
State recommends the signature bond be reinstated. 
BY THE COURT:  Signature bond is reinstated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 09:30 am.
